message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.CR 

Reasoning: The paper deals with fault-tolerant broadcast algorithms in a wireless network, which falls under the categories of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI). The paper also discusses bit and message complexities, which are related to Information Theory (cs.IT). The selective broadcast model and its potential for directional transmissions may also fall under the category of Systems and Control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper deals with Byzantine faults, which is a topic in Cryptography and Security (cs.CR).
